faqs.question: Wie viel kostet diese Immobilie?
faqs.answer: €709,900. This premium 3-bedroom villa in Finestrat represents outstanding value at €4,580 per square meter—40% below comparable island property markets. Flexible payment arrangements can be discussed with serious buyers, and financing options exist for qualified applicants.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca demonstrates consistent year-on-year appreciation of approximately 8%, supported by sustainable international demand and limited premium supply. The region offers Mediterranean lifestyle benefits, established expatriate communities, and strong rental income potential. Property values have recovered strongly post-2015 crisis, establishing stable market fundamentals.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes, completely. Non-residents can purchase property without restrictions; no special visa or residency status is required. Spanish law provides equal property rights to foreign and Spanish nationals. Professional legal representation ensures compliance with formalities and tax obligations, typically completed within 8-12 weeks.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Total acquisition costs typically reach 8-10% of purchase price. Expenses include: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (€800-1,500), property registration (€500-1,000), and legal representation (€1,500-3,000). Mortgage arrangement fees and property surveys add approximately 2-3% additional cost. Spanish tax authorities require careful documentation of source funds.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Grundsteuern in Spanien?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value, typically €600-1,200 for a property of this value. Non-resident owners pay additional 3% wealth tax on properties exceeding €600,000. Rental income generates standard income tax obligations at progressive rates (19-45%). Professional accountancy support ensures compliance and optimization of tax positions.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Multiple Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to non-residents, typically financing 50-70% of purchase price at favorable rates (currently 2.5-3.5%). Applications require income verification, credit documentation, and property appraisal. Non-EU citizens may require Spanish tax identification number (NIE). Processing typically requires 4-6 weeks.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers 30-40% lower living costs compared to UK and Northern Europe. Groceries cost €50-70 weekly for one person; restaurant meals range €8-15; utility expenses average €100-150 monthly. Private healthcare costs €100-300 annually for comprehensive insurance. Property maintenance, domestic help, and leisure activities remain substantially cheaper than Northern European equivalents.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca gut für Rentner?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca attracts thousands of retirees annually due to affordable living, Mediterranean climate, healthcare quality, and established expatriate communities. Pension income stretches further due to lower costs. Spanish residency supports healthcare access under state system. Numerous social clubs, recreational activities, and English-speaking support networks facilitate integration and social engagement.

faqs.question: Wie weit ist die Costa Blanca von Deutschland entfernt?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport, 28 kilometers from Finestrat, operates as major gateway with direct flights to London, Manchester, and regional UK airports. Flight time averages 2-2.5 hours; budget airlines offer competitive pricing (€40-120 return). Ferry alternatives exist from southern Spain ports. Regional connectivity supports frequent UK visits and family accessibility.

faqs.question: What is the weather like in Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean climate delivers 300+ days annual sunshine with mild winters (10-17°C average) and warm summers (25-32°C). Rainfall concentrates November-February; summer drought extends May-September. Sea temperatures range 14°C winter to 27°C summer. The climate suits outdoor living year-round, with seasonal variations providing comfortable Mediterranean living throughout all seasons.
